Dear David,  

  

Thank you for applying for the position Summer Intern - Information Technology
- Data Value and Ideation-2213756 and your interest in Boehringer Ingelheim.
We received your completed application which we will review shortly and inform
you about the next steps.

Until then, we appreciate your patience.



Please note: You can access Boehringer Ingelheim’s career portal where you can
edit and update the applicant data entered in the system. New vacancies will
be published on our Career Section regularly. If you wish to apply for other
career opportunities within Boehringer Ingelheim please log in here with your
personal career portal log-in. You will then have unlimited access to the
portal.



Your career portal log-in:

User name: davidleewang



Please note that your personal data will be stored in our system in accordance
with local regulations.



If you have any questions about your application or the recruitment process,
please do not hesitate to  contact us.





Best regards,  
  
Boehringer Ingelheim Talent Acquisition Team  
  
Click here to find our local Talent Acquisition contacts.





  
---

Dear David ,  
  
Thank you for your interest in Becton Dickinson. This automated response
indicates that we have received your application for the position of R-455893
BD Summer Intern Program 2023 - Global Customer Services Intern, Data
Analytics & Customer Experience (Remote) (Evergreen) (Open) and are currently
reviewing your experience and qualifications. If your profile corresponds to
our requirements, a member of our HR Department will contact you soon.  
  
We appreciate the time you have taken to prepare your application and thank
you for considering this role.  
  
Please visit our career site to check on your application status at
bd.com/careers  
  
PLEASE NOTE: if you are a current BD employee, you need to apply to jobs via
the internal "careers" icon within Workday using "Find Jobs"  
  
Thank you,  
  
Human Resources Department/Recruitment BD

Dear MSDS New Student Body, Welcome to MSDS! This email includes information
on the following: * Student Handbook * Program of Work * Program Deposit *
Correspondence * Course Offerings * Registration and Bars * Orientation * MSDS
Central Course STUDENT HANDBOOK Attached is the most recent version of the
Student Handbook. It is important to review this each semester for program
updates. PROGRAM OF WORK Attached is the Program of Work associated with our
program. There may be updates to this document throughout your time in MSDS.
The first row of courses is meant to illustrate that it is recommended to take
these courses first, and then follow along to the second and third rows. This
is recommended but will not be enforced. Please see below on how best to
navigate our program: [Diagram Description automatically generated] PROGRAM
DEPOSIT A program deposit of $500 will be sent to you by Thursday, December
1st. This is to solidify your spot in the program and will be applied to your
first semester tuition. The due date for the Program Deposit is December 30th,
2022. CORRESPONDENCE With over 1,800 students it is important to include your
EID on all communication. Please do not respond to mass emails like this. Your
email will get lost. It is best to start a new email or change the subject
line (perhaps add your EID) so that we can see your email in a timely fashion.
It is important to direct all correspondence to the grad alias:
MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu We notice that some non-ut email addresses send
our correspondence to spam filters. Please be certain to account for this or
create a utexas email address and let us know that you would like us to send
correspondence there. You received guidance on how to do this in your Welcome
& Onboarding email. COURSE OFFERINGS The following courses will be offered for
the Spring semester: Spring 2023 MSDS Course Listing DSC 381 Probability &
Simulation-based Inference DSC 382 Regression DSC 383 Advanced Predictive
Models DSC 385 Data Exploration & Visualization DSC 388J Optimization DSC 391L
Machine Learning DSC 395T Deep Learning DSC 395T Data Structures & Algorithms
SUMMER 2023 & FALL 2023 We do not have a tentative listing at this time, as
soon as we do, we will update you. REGISTRATION AND BARS To be certain
registration goes smoothly in January, please go to the RIS page for any
registration bars. Here are some helpful steps: · Go to the Registration
Information Sheet page: https://utdirect.utexas.edu/registrar/ris.WBX · Input
your EID · Select Spring 2023 · Hit Submit How to clear bars: · If you see a
Dean of Students bar, please update your information as soon as possible. · If
you see an international office bar, go to this link:
https://global.utexas.edu/isss/myio . If you are not able to clear the bar
through the website, send an email with your EID and relevant bar information
to hotline@austin.utexas.edu. · If you see a J-bar, please contact txglobal-
jbar@austin.utexas.edu  · If you see a medical bar, note that we will be
lifting this on your behalf; please do not contact us about this bar. · If you
see an advising bar, please contact us right away. · If you see a GIAC bar,
review bar information on the GIAC website. If you have additional questions,
contact gradtranscript@austin.utexas.edu. · If you see a Financial
Responsibility Statement (SAR Bar) for Spring 2023, please review and sign
electronically to acknowledge. It will mention that for Option III programs it
will be dependent on the department. As you know, courses are invoiced per
semester as you progress in the program. Good things to know: * We do not cap
our courses so it is unlikely you will not get into the course you select. *
We recommend that new students, especially working professionals, take one or
two courses their first semester. * Each course will take about eight to
fifteen hours of your time, each week. ORIENTATION Please view our orientation
video to help answer any questions you may have prior to starting courses.
MSDS CENTRAL COURSE In the next few weeks, you will be added to the MSDS
Central course on the edX platform. We will provide instructions prior to that
about how to connect to the edX platform and what email to associate with your
program. The MSDS Central course in edX is your headquarters for all MSDS
program information. MSDS Central contains important information about dates,
deadlines and procedures, as well as an FAQ that provides information on
common student questions and requests. Before contacting the program office,
please consult MSDS Central for information on courses, enrollment,
registration, and other important topics. We look forward to you starting our
program! Please let us know if you have any questions. Thanks! Tim Schriewer &
Kathryn Murphy Program Coordinators for Online Programs \--- mail_boundary ---

Dear MSDS New Student Body,



Welcome to MSDS!



This email includes information on the following:

  * Student Handbook
  * Program of Work
  * Program Deposit
  * Correspondence
  * Course Offerings
  * Registration and Bars
  * Orientation
  * MSDS Central Course



**STUDENT HANDBOOK**  
Attached is the most recent version of the Student Handbook. It is important
to review this each semester for program updates.

  
**PROGRAM OF WORK**  
Attached is the Program of Work associated with our program. There may be
updates to this document throughout your time in MSDS. The first row of
courses is meant to illustrate that it is recommended to take these courses
first, and then follow along to the second and third rows. This is recommended
but will not be enforced. Please see below on how best to navigate our
program:





**PROGRAM DEPOSIT**

A program deposit of $500 will be sent to you by Thursday, December 1st. This
is to solidify your spot in the program and will be applied to your first
semester tuition. The due date for the Program Deposit is **December 30 th,
2022**.



**CORRESPONDENCE**

With over 1,800 students it is important to include your EID on all
communication. Please do not respond to mass emails like this. Your email will
get lost. It is best to start a new email or change the subject line (perhaps
add your EID) so that we can see your email in a timely fashion. It is
important to direct all correspondence to the grad alias:
MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu



We notice that some non-ut email addresses send our correspondence to spam
filters. Please be certain to account for this or create a utexas email
address and let us know that you would like us to send correspondence there.
You received guidance on how to do this in your Welcome & Onboarding email.



**COURSE OFFERINGS**

The following courses will be offered for the Spring semester:



**Spring 2023 MSDS Course Listing**

DSC 381 Probability & Simulation-based Inference

DSC 382 Regression

DSC 383 Advanced Predictive Models

DSC 385 Data Exploration & Visualization

DSC 388J Optimization ****

DSC 391L Machine Learning

DSC 395T Deep Learning

DSC 395T Data Structures & Algorithms



**SUMMER 2023 & FALL 2023**

We do not have a tentative listing at this time, as soon as we do, we will
update you.





**REGISTRATION AND BARS**

To be certain registration goes smoothly in January, please go to the RIS page
for any registration bars. Here are some helpful steps:  
·      Go to the Registration Information Sheet page:
https://utdirect.utexas.edu/registrar/ris.WBX  
·      Input your EID  
·      Select Spring 2023  
·      Hit Submit



How to clear bars:  



·                     If you see a **Dean of Students**  bar, please update
your information as soon as possible.

·                     If you see an **international office**  bar, go to this
link: https://global.utexas.edu/isss/myio . If you are not able to clear the
bar through the website, send an email with your EID and relevant bar
information to _hotline@austin.utexas.edu_.

·                     If you see a **J-bar** , please contact txglobal-
jbar@austin.utexas.edu

·                     If you see a **medical  **bar, note that we will be
lifting this on your behalf; please do not contact us about this bar.

·                     If you see an **advising**  bar, please contact us right
away.

·                     If you see a **GIAC** bar, review bar information on the
GIAC website. If you have additional questions, contact
gradtranscript@austin.utexas.edu.

·                     If you see a **Financial Responsibility Statement (SAR
Bar)** for Spring 2023, please review and sign electronically to acknowledge.
It will mention that for Option III programs it will be dependent on the
department. As you know, courses are invoiced per semester as you progress in
the program.  



 Good things to know:

  * We do not cap our courses so it is unlikely you will not get into the course you select.
  * We recommend that new students, especially working professionals, take one or two courses their first semester. 
  * Each course will take about eight to fifteen hours of your time, each week.



**ORIENTATION**

 Please view our orientation video to help answer any questions you may have
prior to starting courses.





**MSDS CENTRAL COURSE**

In the next few weeks, you will be added to the MSDS Central course on the edX
platform. We will provide instructions prior to that about how to connect to
the edX platform and what email to associate with your program.



The MSDS Central course in edX is your headquarters for all MSDS program
information. MSDS Central contains important information about dates,
deadlines and procedures, as well as an FAQ that provides information on

This email includes information on the following:

  * Spring 2023 Confirm Attendance
  * Point of Contact
  * Spring 2023 Delete Drop Period
  * Spring 2023 Graduation Application
  * Medical Insurance Waiver for International Students
  * Spring 2023 Important Dates

  
**Confirming Attendance for Spring 2023**  
Every student enrolled in the Spring 2023 semester needs to Confirm Attendance
in the My Tuition Bill webpage before January 12th. It is important to
understand that Confirming Attendance essentially confirms your commitment to
attending the Spring 2023 semester and paying for your course(s).  
  
If a student does not Confirm Attendance, they may be automatically dropped
from their courses by UT system. If a student is dropped from their course(s)
and wants to be added back, they would incur a late registration fee (anywhere
from $50 to $200 - amounts are dictated by the Registrar).  
  
You may confirm attendance on the tuition page. Note that our department is
part of the College of Natural Sciences, so do not be alarmed if you see
Natural Sciences listed there.  
  
Please note that if you have recently registered for courses, it may take at
least 24 hours for your What I Owe page, edX and My Tuition Bill page (student
fees to be $0.00) to accurately reflect your registration.  
  
**Points of Contact**  
Throughout the semester you may need assistance. Here is a list to guide you:  
Accounting Inquiries: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu  
Program Inquiries: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu  
Class or content related issues: contact your class TA (listed in syllabi)  
Technical issues with edX platform: support-masters@edx.org  
  
**Delete Drop Period**  
We are currently in the Delete Drop Period for the Spring 2023 semester, and
it will run through January 25th.  
  
A student may drop a course online through the fourth class day (January
12th).  
  
From the fifth class day through the 12th class day (January 12th – January
25th), a student will need to complete the Delete Drop Form that our office
will provide in the next few days.  
  
__Please understand that if you add or drop a course during this time period,
our office needs 24 to 48 hours to update edX and WIO.__  
  
**If you intend to drop your only course, or all your courses,** _this is not
a Delete Drop - this is a withdrawal._ Only a certain percentage of your
tuition may be refunded. Information on how much will be refunded is available
through this link and on the back of the form you will need to sign to
withdraw.  
  
Here is how to request withdrawal information:  
Email: MSDSGradCoordinator@austin.utexas.edu  
Subject: MSDS – Spring 2023 - Withdrawal Request - EID (be sure to enter your
EID in the subject line)  
Body of email: include a request for withdrawing from the semester.  
What to expect: A withdrawal form will be sent for you to complete.  
  
**Spring 2023 Graduation Application**  
During their final semester, all MSDS students must apply to graduate. To
learn more about graduation requirements and to access the graduation
application, please go here. If you receive an error after trying to complete
the application, please let us know.  
  
While the University’s deadline to submit a graduation application is March
31st, 2023, we ask that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please
turn in your application no later than 5:00pm on March 30th so we can complete
and submit the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate application
should only be submitted for those who plan on graduating at the end of this
semester.  
  
Students who do not complete this process by March 31st will not be eligible
to receive their degree this fall. If you intend to graduate this semester, go
ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the deadline.  
  
**International Student Insurance Waiver**  
If you are an international student, there is a chance you may automatically
be enrolled in student health insurance based on your status.  
  
You have probably been receiving emails from the International Office and if
you have not already done this, it is **vitally important** for you to read
this message from Texas Global to guide you:

  * The University of Texas Board of Regents requires all international students in a F-1, F-2, J-1, or J-2 visa status to have health insurance coverage which complies with the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA). For this reason, enrollment in the UT Student Health Insurance Plan is automatic at the time of registration.
  * This cost will be covered by the department and then extended to the student in the middle of the semester.
    * International students who are studying within the US and do not want this coverage, may request a waiver as long as they can show proof of health insurance coverage that meets the Board of Regents requirements. This means the student must submit the waiver form and submit proof of the required health insurance coverage. It is the student’s responsibility to request a waiver before the 10th class day of each semester.
      * It is good to note that if the proof of insurance does not include medical evacuation and repatriation coverages, then the student will automatically be enrolled in this. The department will extend this cost to the student.

  
Please be certain to complete this waiver form as soon as possible. The
deadline is **Monday, January 23 rd, 2023 at 5:00pm CST.**

**Reviewing your Application**

First, we carefully review your application to ensure your skills and

rounds of interviews the hiring manager and others taking from 2-4 weeks,
depending on schedules.

Instagram.

Dear David Wang  
  
Thank you for your interest in Alcon. Please be informed that your resume has
been carefully reviewed for the following position: Summer 2023 Intern – Data
Analyst (R-2023-22124).  
  
However, after thorough consideration by the hiring team, we have identified
other candidates whose credentials and qualifications are a closer match to
the needs of this position.  
  
We will continue to consider your application for other positions within
Alcon. Our recruiters at Alcon will be able to access your Information and may
contact you should a suitable opening arise. Please also apply directly for
any other position that might be suitable match for your background.  
  
The information you submitted during your application process will be retained
in the global candidate database for 12 months since you last loaded a resume
/ CV, or longer if you are still being considered for an open position. If you
have applied for a position based in the United States, your Information will
be retained for a period of 36 months (or longer if required by law) after the
recruitment process for that position has been completed.  
  
  
If you want your data to be deleted earlier than the indicated periods, please
_Delete My Information_ in Account Settings on your Candidate Home . You may
resubmit new information with updated details at any time on our website.  
  
Thank you for your time and interest in Alcon. We wish you every success in
your future endeavors.

Sincerely,  
  
Alcon Talent Acquisition

This email includes information on the following:

  * Summer 2023 Registration
  * Fall 2023 Registration
  * Spring 2023 Graduation Application Reminder
  * Spring 2023 Important Dates

  
**SUMMER 2023 REGISTRATION**  
The first registration period for Summer 2023 will be from April 3rd – April
14th. Attached is a Summer 2023 Registration Guide that we recommend you
review prior to April 3rd so that you are best prepared to register for
courses.  
  
There will be a second registration period for Summer 2023 from May 22nd – May
24th. The Summer 2023 semester will start on June 1st and run through August
14th.  
  
As a reminder, **taking courses during the Summer semester is optional** and a
Leave of Absence is not required for students that wish to not take courses.
Please note that the Summer semester is only 12 weeks long whereas the Fall
and Spring semesters are 16 weeks long. The coursework will be at a faster
pace during the Summer semester.  
  
Here is the final Summer 2023 course list:

  * DSC 383 Advanced Predictive Models
  * DSC 382 Regression
  * DSC 391L Machine Learning
  * DSC 394D Deep Learning

**FALL 2023 REGISTRATION**  
Registration for Fall 2023 will start in July. Our office will send out the
Fall 2023 Registration Guide around the middle of June. Here is the
_tentative_ course list for Fall 2023:

  * DSC 381 Probability
  * DSC 385 Data Exploration and Visualization
  * DSC 384 Design Principles and Causal Inference
  * DSC 395T Data Structures and Algorithms
  * DSC 391L Machine Learning
  * DSC 394D Deep Learning
  * DSC 395T Optimization
  * DSC 388 Natural Language Processing
  * DSC 395T Reinforcement Learning

**SPRING 2023 GRADUATION APPLICATION REMINDER**  
During their final semester, all MSDS students must apply to graduate. To
learn more about graduation requirements and to access the graduation
application, please go here. If you receive an error after trying to complete
the application, please let us know.  
  
While the University’s deadline to submit a graduation application is March
31st, 2023, we ask that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please
turn in your application no later than 5:00pm on March 30th so we can complete
and submit the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate application
should only be submitted for those who plan on graduating at the end of this
semester.  
  
Students who do not complete this process by March 31st will not be eligible
to receive their degree this spring. If you intend to graduate this semester,
go ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the deadline.  
  
**SPRING 2023 IMPORTANT DATES**  
Here is a list of important dates for our program. This is also available in
your Central course.  
**Spring 2023 Important Dates**

Hi David, Thank you for your interest in Vista Equity Partners! In order to
complete your application, we ask that you complete an online assessment,
accessible through the link below. The assessment will require approximately
30 minutes and consists of two parts: a cognitive assessment and a personality
assessment. If you have previously completed an assessment for another
position within Vista or with a Vista Portfolio Company, you are not required
to retest, however, if you would like to use your previous assessment results
for this recruiting process, please let your recruiter know. If you would like
to retake the assessment, please do so with the link below. Once you begin the
assessment, it cannot be stopped or restarted. You cannot skip questions or go
back and change previous answers. It is recommended that you complete the
assessment in a quiet environment and without interruptions, on a laptop or
desktop computer with reliable internet service. Cognitive Assessment: You
have 15 minutes to answer 50 multiple-choice questions. The goal is to answer
as many questions as possible and get as many correct as possible, with the
knowledge that you are not penalized for incorrect answers or guesses. Do not
spend too much time on any one question – it is best to make an educated guess
to maintain efficiency. You may use a pen and paper, but you are NOT permitted
to use calculators or any other problem-solving device. If you move further in
the process, we will verify the results with a follow up assessment.
Personality Assessment: You are responding to statements about yourself;
answer in a way that most accurately describes you. This section is untimed
and there are no right or wrong answers. To begin the assessment, click the
following link:
https://www.ondemandassessment.com/verify/index/VSTfjxVSEji91MN2 If you have
any technical issues with the test, please contact Criteria Corp's Candidate
Support team in the chat located in the bottom right-hand side of the
assessment window. Thank you again for your interest in Vista! The Vista
Recruiting team will be in touch following the completion of the assessment.
Best, Vista Recruiting \--- mail_boundary ---

Hi David,

Thank you for your interest in Vista Equity Partners! In order to complete
your application, we ask that you complete an online assessment, accessible
through the link below. The assessment will require approximately 30 minutes
and consists of two parts: a cognitive assessment and a personality
assessment. If you have previously completed an assessment for another
position within Vista or with a Vista Portfolio Company, you are not required
to retest, however, if you would like to use your previous assessment results
for this recruiting process, please let your recruiter know. If you would like
to retake the assessment, please do so with the link below.

  * Once you begin the assessment, it cannot be stopped or restarted.
  * You cannot skip questions or go back and change previous answers.
  * It is recommended that you complete the assessment in a quiet environment and without interruptions, on a laptop or desktop computer with reliable internet service.

**_Cognitive Assessment:_**

  * You have 15 minutes to answer 50 multiple-choice questions.
  * The goal is to answer as many questions as possible and get as many correct as possible, with the knowledge that you are not penalized for incorrect answers or guesses. 
  * Do not spend too much time on any one question – it is best to make an educated guess to maintain efficiency.
  * You may use a pen and paper, but you are NOT permitted to use calculators or any other problem-solving device.
  * If you move further in the process, we will verify the results with a follow up assessment.

**_Personality Assessment:_**

  * You are responding to statements about yourself; answer in a way that most accurately describes you.
  * This section is untimed and there are no right or wrong answers.

To begin the assessment, click the following link:

https://www.ondemandassessment.com/verify/index/VSTfjxVSEji91MN2

If you have any technical issues with the test, please contact Criteria Corp's
Candidate Support team in the chat located in the bottom right-hand side of
the assessment window.

Thank you again for your interest in Vista! The Vista Recruiting team will be
in touch following the completion of the assessment.

Best,

Vista Recruiting

Hi David: We just received your resume and would like to thank you for your
interest in working at OmniAb. This email confirms that your application has
been submitted for the Summer Lab Intern - Data Science job. Our team will
carefully assess your qualifications for the role you selected and others that
may be a fit. Should there be a suitable match, we will be sure to get in
touch. We're including a copy of the job description below for your records.
Thanks again for applying to OmniAb.
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summer Lab Intern - Data Science at OmniAb in Durham, NC We have an exciting
Summer Lab Intern opportunity in our Data Science group. This is a 10 to
12-week hands-on summer Internship located at our site in Research Triangle
Park (RTP), North Carolina. The Intern will develop the infrastructure,
processes and data analysis tools that will be capable of merging data streams
from our scientific groups into a set of resources that can be used by
scientists across the company. About Us: OmniAb consists of dynamic and
innovative scientists that employ a variety of novel platforms to discover
next generation therapeutics. OmniAb has best-in-class capabilities for the
discovery of novel treatments for diseases associated with ion channel and
transporter targets, and proprietary technology to engineer animals to
generate affinity matured human sequence antibodies for use in the treatment
of human disease. We are looking for accomplished team players who are
enthusiastic to contribute to the technological frontier of drug discovery,
contribute to improving human health, and passionate in their desire to
develop new therapeutic agents. See OmniAb.com for more details about the
exciting science being performed at OmniAb. This summer you will: • Help
design a data model to meet relevant corporate data integration and display
goals. • Access databases and extract, load and transform biologically
relevant data and metadata into active data sources. • Prototype live data
analysis apps for project-level discovery using several existing platforms. •
Iterate through cycles of rapid development to arrive at a useful, extensible
set of tools. Requirements: • Current Undergrad or Master’s degree •
Background in data science; proficiency in SQL, Python, data visualization •
Must be 18 years or older to apply • Ability to multitask, work in a fast-
paced environment • Ability to work independently and as part of a team •
Excellent interpersonal skills Additional Information: • All new hires are
required to go through background checks • OmniAb is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets
employer • Must be legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship •
OmniAb celebrates the diversity of life and welcomes all individuals to apply
• New hires & Interns based in the US will be required to demonstrate that

Hi David:

We just received your resume and would like to thank you for your interest in
working at OmniAb. This email confirms that your application has been
submitted for the Summer Lab Intern - Data Science job.

Our team will carefully assess your qualifications for the role you selected

Summer Lab Intern - Data Science

Icagen Information Services | Durham, NC

|  
---  
  
We have an exciting **Summer Lab Intern** opportunity in our Data Science
group. This is a 10 to 12-week hands-on summer Internship located at our site
in Research Triangle Park (RTP), North Carolina. The Intern will develop the
infrastructure, processes and data analysis tools that will be capable of
merging data streams from our scientific groups into a set of resources that
can be used by scientists across the company.

**About Us:**

OmniAb consists of dynamic and innovative scientists that employ a variety of
novel platforms to discover next generation therapeutics. OmniAb has best-in-
class capabilities for the discovery of novel treatments for diseases
associated with ion channel and transporter targets, and proprietary
technology to engineer animals to generate affinity matured human sequence
antibodies for use in the treatment of human disease. We are looking for
accomplished team players who are enthusiastic to contribute to the
technological frontier of drug discovery, contribute to improving human
health, and passionate in their desire to develop new therapeutic agents. See
OmniAb.com for more details about the exciting science being performed at
OmniAb.

**This summer you will:**

  * Help design a data model to meet relevant corporate data integration and display goals.

  * Access databases and extract, load and transform biologically relevant data and metadata into active data sources.

  * Prototype live data analysis apps for project-level discovery using several existing platforms.

  * Iterate through cycles of rapid development to arrive at a useful, extensible set of tools.

**Requirements:**

  * Current Undergrad or Master’s degree

  * Background in data science; proficiency in SQL, Python, data visualization

  * Must be 18 years or older to apply

  * Ability to multitask, work in a fast-paced environment

  * Ability to work independently and as part of a team

  * Excellent interpersonal skills

**Additional Information:**

  * All new hires are required to go through background checks

  * OmniAb is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets employer

  * Must be legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship

  * OmniAb celebrates the diversity of life and welcomes all individuals to apply

  * New hires & Interns based in the US will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated and boosted for COVID-19 or qualify for a medical or religious exemption or accommodation to this vaccination requirement

  * Please Note: Intern will be responsible for all transportation costs, housing, and personal health insurance

**Base Pay Range: $22 - $36/per hour**

The pay range provided is an estimated base range for this role. Exact
compensation may vary based on skills, experience, education level, and
location.

_OmniAb, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate
against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the
basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class._

Hi David,  
  
Thank you for taking the time to apply to (MASTER REQUISITION/EVERGREEN) 2023
Research and Development Summer Internship and going through our hiring
process. We really appreciate your interest in joining Johnson & Johnson. As
you go through the process, we take the time to review your professional
background and experience and make sure that they align with what’s needed for
the role. Though your achievements are impressive, they didn’t exactly line up
with what we’re looking for in this particular job. We want you to know that
there are three main reasons as to why it might not have worked out and some
have nothing to do with you:

  1. Timing: sometimes it just doesn’t work out for the role you want and what we have available. It doesn’t mean that you aren’t qualified or capable of handling the role.
  2. Shift in priorities: we might have decided to go in a different direction based on changing business needs.
  3. There might have been a more qualified candidate for the role.

We understand that being rejected is always disappointing no matter how far
along you’ve made it in the process. But, don’t let it hold you back. Your
relationship with Johnson & Johnson doesn’t end here and there are some things
you can do to open yourself up to other possibilities:

  1. Refer back to Shine to take advantage of valuable content in articles and videos that will help you bounce back. Also, get practical guidance and general career advice related to our hiring experience and what to do after you submit an application—all information you can use in the future, whether at Johnson & Johnson or beyond. Simply log in with your Careers website credentials.
  2. Continue to search and apply for other job openings by visiting our Careers Website. We’re constantly adding new positions that may be a better fit for you.

If you did not opt in during the application process and you would like
Johnson & Johnson to keep your application data on file with the purpose of
identifying and sending you relevant information about future career
opportunities that match your skills and preferences, please go here and
provide your consent.  
We wish you the best of luck as you continue your search and we hope that this
won’t be the last time we cross paths.  
  
Best,  
| Johnson & Johnson Talent Acquisition Team

If Self-Employment:

  * Tax records (must have company and candidate name listed)
  * Pay records

Good afternoon, This email includes information on the following: Confirming
Attendance for Summer 2023 Summer 2023 Delete Drop Period Summer 2023 Late Add
Requests Summer 2023 Invoices & Receipts Summer 2023 Graduation Summer 2023
Important Dates CONFIRMING ATTENDANCE FOR SUMMER 2023 Every student enrolled
in a summer course needs to Confirm Attendance before June 6th. It is
important to understand that Confirming Attendance essentially confirms your
commitment to attending the Summer 2023 semester and paying for your
course(s). If a student does not Confirm Attendance, they may be automatically
dropped from their courses by UT system. If a student is dropped from their
course(s) and wants to be added back, they would incur a late registration fee
(anywhere from $50 to $200 - amounts are dictated by the Registrar). You may
confirm attendance on the My Tuition Bill page. Note that our department is
part of the College of Natural Sciences, so do not be alarmed if you see
Natural Sciences listed there. If you do not confirm attendance, you run the
risk of being dropped on the UT side and may incur a fee to be re-registered.
If you want to drop all your summer courses and you have not yet confirmed
attendance, try self-cancelling. You can attempt to cancel your summer
registration here https://utdirect.utexas.edu/apps/reg/registration/cancel/.
Please let us know if you were able to self-cancel as the systems are not
joined and it will require some manual parts on our end. We do not recommend
relying on the system to drop you from your courses, it is best practice to
follow the steps associated with self-cancelling. SUMMER 2023 DELETE DROP
PERIOD We are currently in the Delete Drop Period for the Summer 2023
semester, and it will run through June 6th. A student may drop a course online
through this Friday, June 2nd. From June 3rd through June 6th, a student will
need to complete the Delete Drop Form in order to drop a course. The Delete
Drop Form will be active starting on June 3rd and will be inactive starting at
12:00pm CT on June 6th. Delete Drop Form
https://utexas.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3DZDke6N13JfD3U If you intend to drop
your only course, or all your courses, this is not a Delete Drop - this is a
withdrawal. Only a certain percentage of your tuition may be refunded.
Information on how much will be refunded is available through this link and on
the back of the form you will need to sign to withdraw. Here is how to request
withdrawal information: Email: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu Subject: MSDS –
Summer 2023 - Withdrawal Request - EID (be sure to enter your EID in the
subject line) Body of email: include a request for withdrawing from the
semester. What to expect: A withdrawal form will be sent for you to complete.
SUMMER 2023 LATE ADD REQUESTS Students can add themselves to a course through
the UT Registration System through this Friday, June 2nd. After June 2nd,
students can only be added to a course through our office. Before our office
can late add a student to a course, they must have received permission from
the instructor to be late added. If you received permission from the
instructor to be late added to their course, then please forward it to our
office at MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu with the following information:
Subject: MSDS – Summer 2023 – Late Add Request – EID Body of email: include
your name, EID, and the course to be added Please understand that if you are
added to a course, it may take 36 hours to be added to on the edX side. SUMMER
2023 INVOICES AND RECEIPTS If a student makes an adjustment to their
registration, a new invoice will be sent for their records. Remember, the
systems are not linked, meaning the invoice will not include payment
information. Fee invoices will be sent out in the next week or so, please be
on the lookout for those. Tuition is due June 6, 2023. Fee invoices will be
due June 15, 2023. If you have a letter of credit from your employer in order
to pay your tuition, please forward it to us via the following email format:
Email: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu Subject: MSDS – Summer 2023 – Employer
Payment - EID (be sure to enter your EID in the subject line) Body of email:
include your name, EID, your employer’s name and attach the letter of credit
What to expect: A confirmation email from us that this has been sent We
anticipate sending receipts for the summer semester, no later than June 23rd.
SUMMER 2023 GRADUATION APPLICATION During their final semester, all MSDS
students must apply to graduate. To learn more about graduation requirements
and to access the graduation application, please go here. If you receive an
error after trying to complete the application, please let us know. While the
University’s deadline to submit a graduation application is 5:00 pm July 28th,
we ask that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please turn in
your application no later than 5:00pm on July 27th so we can complete and
submit the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate application should
only be submitted for those who plan on graduating at the end of this
semester. Students who do not complete this process by July 28th will not be
eligible to receive their degree this summer. If you intend to graduate this
semester, go ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the
deadline. SUMMER 2023 IMPORTANT DATES Here is a list of important dates for
our program. This is also available in your Central course. Summer 2023
Important Dates June 1st First class day June 1st – June 2nd Late Registration
for all students who had not yet registered, $25 Late Registration fee in

that. Add/Drops for registered students June 1st – June 6th Delete drop
period. Classes added and dropped online from June 1st – June 2nd. Classes
added and dropped in the department offering the course June 3rd – June 6th.
Delete drop requests due by 12:00pm CT on June 6th to account for processing.
*No courses will be added after the second-class day unless the student has
reach out to the instructor and the instructor approved the request June 6th
Confirm Attendance Deadline. If one fails to confirm attendance, they may be
dropped from their courses and may incur a fee. June 3rd – June 6th
Departmental Add/Drops Classes added or dropped with Departmental Approval.
$50 Late Registration fee for those who have not yet been registered June 6th

Fall 2023 Important Dates CONFIRMING ATTENDANCE FOR FALL 2023 Every student
enrolled in the Fall 2023 semester needs to Confirm Attendance in the My
Tuition Bill webpage before August 24th. It is important to understand that
Confirming Attendance essentially confirms your commitment to attending the
Fall 2023 semester and paying for your course(s). If a student does not
Confirm Attendance, they may be automatically dropped from their courses by UT
system. If a student is dropped from their course(s) and wants to be added
back, they would incur a late registration fee (anywhere from $50 to $200 -
amounts are dictated by the Registrar). You may confirm attendance on the My
Tuition Bill page. Note that our department is part of the College of Natural
Sciences, so do not be alarmed if you see Natural Sciences listed there.
Please note that if you have recently registered for courses, it may take at
least 24 hours for your What I Owe page, edX and My Tuition Bill page (student
fees to be $0.00) to accurately reflect your registration. POINTS OF CONTACT
Throughout the semester you may need assistance. Here is a list to guide you:
Accounting Inquiries: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu Program Inquiries:
MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu Class or content related issues: contact your
class TA (listed in syllabi) Technical issues with edX platform: support-
masters@edx.org FALL 2023 DELETE DROP PERIOD We are currently in the Delete
Drop Period for the FALL 2023 semester, and it will run through September 6th.
A student may drop a course online through the fourth class day (August 24th).
From the fifth class day through the 12th class day (August 25th – September
6th), a student will need to complete the Delete Drop Form that our office
will provide in the next few days. Please understand that if you add or drop a
course during this time period, our office needs 24 to 48 hours to update edX
and WIO. If you intend to drop your only course, or all your courses, this is
not a Delete Drop - this is a withdrawal. Only a certain percentage of your
tuition may be refunded. Information on how much will be refunded is available
through this link and on the back of the form you will need to sign to
withdraw. Here is how to request withdrawal information: Email:
MSDSGradCoordinator@utexas.edu Subject: MSDS – Fall 2023 - Withdrawal Request
– YOUR EID Body of email: include a request for withdrawing from the semester.
What to expect: A withdrawal form will be sent for you to complete. FALL 2023
GRADUATION APPLICATION During their final semester, all MSDS students must
apply to graduate. To learn more about graduation requirements and to access
the graduation application, please go here. If you receive an error after
trying to complete the application, please let us know. While the University’s
deadline to submit a graduation application is November 10th, 2023, we ask
that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please turn in your
application no later than 5:00pm on November 9th so we can complete and submit
the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate application should only be
submitted for those who plan on graduating at the end of this semester.
Students who do not complete this process by November 10th, 2023 will not be
eligible to receive their degree this fall. If you intend to graduate this
semester, go ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the
deadline. INTERNATIONAL STUDENT INSURANCE WAIVER If you are an international
student, there is a chance you may automatically be enrolled in student health
insurance based on your status. You have probably been receiving emails from
the International Office and if you have not already done this, it is vitally
important for you to read this message from Texas Global to guide you: The
University of Texas Board of Regents requires all international students in a
F-1, F-2, J-1, or J-2 visa status to have health insurance coverage which
complies with the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
(PPACA). For this reason, enrollment in the UT Student Health Insurance Plan
is automatic at the time of registration. This cost will be covered by the
department and then extended to the student in the middle of the semester.
International students who are studying within the US and do not want this
coverage, may request a waiver as long as they can show proof of health
insurance coverage that meets the Board of Regents requirements. This means
the student must submit the waiver form and submit proof of the required
health insurance coverage. It is the student’s responsibility to request a
waiver before the 10th class day of each semester. It is good to note that if
the proof of insurance does not include medical evacuation and repatriation
coverages, then the student will automatically be enrolled in this. The
department will extend this cost to the student. Please be certain to complete
this waiver form as soon as possible. The deadline is Friday, September 1st,
2023 at 5:00pm CT. FALL 2023 IMPORTANT DATES Here is a list of important dates
for our program. This is also available in your Central course. Important
Registration Dates for Students August 16th – August 17th Registration for
continuing, readmitted, and new students. Wait 48 hours for the program to
send an invoice prior to making a payment. August 18th Students successfully
registered on the UT Austin side will be registered to their courses on the
edX side. Only pre-course material will be available before the first-class
day. August 18th – August 24th Late registration for all students who are not
yet registered. $25 late fee in effect. Add/drops for registered students.

dropped in the department offering the course Aug 26th – Sep 6th. *No courses
will be added after the fourth-class day unless the student has reach out to

Deadline. Tuition for Option III Programs are paid on the What I Owe page.
August 24th Confirm Attendance Deadline. If one fails to confirm attendance,
they may be dropped from their courses and will incur a fee if they wish to
participate in the semester. Students confirm attendance at this link.
September 6th Last day to drop a course with a refund. *Not applicable if last
or only course is being dropped (this is a withdrawal). Delete drop requests
due by 12pm CT on Sep 6th to account for processing time. September 7th –

This email includes information on the following:

  * Confirming Attendance for Fall 2023
  * Points of Contact
  * Fall 2023 Delete Drop Period
  * Fall 2023 Graduation Application
  * International Students Medical Insurance Waiver
  * Fall 2023 Important Dates

  
**CONFIRMING ATTENDANCE FOR FALL 2023**  
Every student enrolled in the Fall 2023 semester needs to Confirm Attendance
in the My Tuition Bill webpage before August 24th. It is important to
understand that Confirming Attendance essentially confirms your commitment to
attending the Fall 2023 semester and paying for your course(s).  
  
If a student does not Confirm Attendance, they may be automatically dropped
from their courses by UT system. If a student is dropped from their course(s)
and wants to be added back, they would incur a late registration fee (anywhere
from $50 to $200 - amounts are dictated by the Registrar).  
  
You may confirm attendance on the My Tuition Bill page. Note that our
department is part of the College of Natural Sciences, so do not be alarmed if
you see Natural Sciences listed there.  
  
**__Please note that if you have recently registered for courses, it may take
at least 24 hours for your What I Owe page, edX and My Tuition Bill page
(student fees to be $0.00) to accurately reflect your registration.__**  
  
**POINTS OF CONTACT**  
Throughout the semester you may need assistance. Here is a list to guide you:  
Accounting Inquiries: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu  
Program Inquiries: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu  
Class or content related issues: contact your class TA (listed in syllabi)  
Technical issues with edX platform: support-masters@edx.org  
  
**FALL 2023 DELETE DROP PERIOD**  
We are currently in the Delete Drop Period for the FALL 2023 semester, and it
will run through September 6th.  
  
A student may drop a course online through the fourth class day (August 24th).  
  
From the fifth class day through the 12th class day (August 25th – September
6th), a student will need to complete the Delete Drop Form that our office
will provide in the next few days.  
  
__Please understand that if you add or drop a course during this time period,
our office needs 24 to 48 hours to update edX and WIO.__  
  
**If you intend to drop your only course, or all your courses,** _this is not
a Delete Drop - this is a withdrawal._ Only a certain percentage of your
tuition may be refunded. Information on how much will be refunded is available
through this link and on the back of the form you will need to sign to
withdraw.  
  
Here is how to request withdrawal information:  
Email: MSDSGradCoordinator@utexas.edu  
Subject: MSDS – Fall 2023 - Withdrawal Request – YOUR EID  
Body of email: include a request for withdrawing from the semester.  
What to expect: A withdrawal form will be sent for you to complete.  
  
**FALL 2023 GRADUATION APPLICATION**  
During their final semester, all MSDS students must apply to graduate. To
learn more about graduation requirements and to access the graduation
application, please go here. If you receive an error after trying to complete
the application, please let us know.  
  
While the University’s deadline to submit a graduation application is November
10th, 2023, we ask that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please
turn in your application no later than 5:00pm on November 9th so we can
complete and submit the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate
application should only be submitted for those who plan on graduating at the
end of this semester.  
  
Students who do not complete this process by November 10th, 2023 will not be
eligible to receive their degree this fall. If you intend to graduate this
semester, go ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the
deadline.  
  
**INTERNATIONAL STUDENT INSURANCE WAIVER**  
If you are an international student, there is a chance you may automatically
be enrolled in student health insurance based on your status.  
  
You have probably been receiving emails from the International Office and if
you have not already done this, it is **vitally important** for you to read
this message from Texas Global to guide you:

  * The University of Texas Board of Regents requires all international students in a F-1, F-2, J-1, or J-2 visa status to have health insurance coverage which complies with the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA). For this reason, enrollment in the UT Student Health Insurance Plan is automatic at the time of registration.
  * This cost will be covered by the department and then extended to the student in the middle of the semester.
    * International students who are studying within the US and do not want this coverage, may request a waiver as long as they can show proof of health insurance coverage that meets the Board of Regents requirements. This means the student must submit the waiver form and submit proof of the required health insurance coverage. It is the student’s responsibility to request a waiver before the 10th class day of each semester.
      * It is good to note that if the proof of insurance does not include medical evacuation and repatriation coverages, then the student will automatically be enrolled in this. The department will extend this cost to the student.

Please be certain to complete this waiver form as soon as possible. The
deadline is **Friday, September 1st, 2023 at 5:00pm CT.**  
  
**FALL 2023 IMPORTANT DATES**  
Here is a list of important dates for our program. This is also available in
your Central course.  
  
**Important Registration Dates for Students**  
August 16th – August 17th | Registration for continuing, readmitted, and new students. **Wait 48 hours for the program to send an invoice prior to making a payment.**  
---|---  
August 18th | Students successfully registered on the UT Austin side will be registered to their courses on the edX side. Only pre-course material will be available before the first-class day.  
August 18th – August 24th | Late registration for all students who are not yet registered. $25 late fee in effect.  
Add/drops for registered students.  
August 21st | First class day.  
August 21st – September 6th | **Delete drop period.**  
Classes added and dropped online from Aug 21st – Aug 24th.  
Classes added and dropped in the department offering the course Aug 26th – Sep
6th.  
_*No courses will be added after the fourth-class day unless the student has
reach out to the instructor and the instructor approved the request_  
August 24th | **Tuition Deadline.**  
Tuition for Option III Programs are paid on the What I Owe page.  
August 24th | **Confirm Attendance Deadline.**  
If one fails to confirm attendance, they may be dropped from their courses and
will incur a fee if they wish to participate in the semester. Students confirm
attendance at this link.  
September 6th | Last day to drop a course with a refund. *Not applicable if last or only course is being dropped (this is a withdrawal).  
Delete drop requests due by 12pm CT on Sep 6th to account for processing time.  
September 7th – September 18th | **Q drop period.**  
Q drop requests due by 12pm CT on Sep 18th to account for processing time.  
Courses may be dropped with the approval of the Graduate Advisor and Graduate
Dean (required) without academic penalty. No refund.  
September 19th – December 4th | **QF drop period.**  
QF drop requests due by 12pm CT on December 4th to account for processing
time.  
Dropping a course requires the approval of the instructor, who must assign a
“Q” or “F”, the Graduate Advisor, and the Graduate Dean. No refund.  
November 10th | Last day to apply for graduation for the Fall 2023 semester.  
December 4th | **Last class day.**  
This is the last day to withdraw or drop a course.  
Withdrawal and QF drop requests due by 12pm CT on Dec 4th to account for
processing time.  
  
Best,  
Kathryn and Tim

Good afternoon, This email includes information on the following: New MSDS
Course Updated MSDS Program of Work NEW MSDS COURSE We are excited to announce
a new MSDS course! DSC 395T Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation
will be taught Dr. Layla Parast and it will be first offered in the Spring
2024 semester. Course Title Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation
Course Description The purpose of this course is to introduce students to
statistical methods used for health data science. Equal emphasis will be given
to the statistical details of the methods and application to data. Each course
component will include an R demonstration as well as R activities to practice
analytic skills. The course will cover the following topics: (1) Survival
analysis, including censoring and functions, nonparametric and parametric
estimation, competing risks, and prediction; (2) Longitudinal data analysis
including linear and generalized mixed effect models and generalized
estimating equations; (3) Design and analysis of observational studies
including propensity score analysis and mediation analysis; (4) Design and
analysis of randomized studies including sample size and power calculations,
intent-to-treat analysis, and noncompliance. At the end of this course,
students will be able to determine the appropriate method for a particular
setting, apply the method, and interpret results, incredibly value skills for
a successful health data science career. Course Prerequisites This course is
designed to be accessible to graduate students interested in learning
biostatistical methods and how to appropriately apply them to health and
medical data. Necessary background includes familiarity with probability,
regression, and mathematical statistics including likelihood estimation and
inference. Students should have experience and be comfortable working in R.
UPDATED MSDS PROGRAM OF WORK With the addition of DSC 395T Data Science for
Health Discovery and Innovation to the MSDS program, there has been an update
to the MSDS program of work. Attached to this email is an updated MSDS Program
of Work checklist, and we will detail the changes below. The MSDS program of
work will now have four different categorizations of courses: Foundational
Courses, Additional Required Courses, Elective Course Group 1, and Elective
Course Group 2. Foundational Course: all three courses are required. DSC 381
Probability DSC 382 Regression DSC 395T Data Structures & Algorithms
Additional Required Courses: both courses are required. DSC 391L Machine
Learning DSC 394D Deep Learning Elective Courses - 1: students must complete
three of the following four courses. DSC 383 Advanced Predictive Models DSC
384 Design Principles & Causal Inference DSC 385 Data Exploration &
Visualization DSC 395T Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation
Elective Courses - 2: students must complete two of the following three
courses. DSC 388J Optimization DSC 395T Reinforcement Learning DSC 395T
Natural Language Processing Please note that the MSDS program will not allow
substitutions of courses. The elective courses will only count towards their
specific group, and will not be eligible to count as a Foundational Course,
Additional Required Course, or towards the other Elective Course Group. Best,
Kathryn and Tim **Please remember to include your EID on all correspondence
and to not respond to these messages directly** \--- mail_boundary ---  Good
afternoon,  
  
This email includes information on the following:  
  
  * New MSDS Course
  * Updated MSDS Program of Work

**NEW MSDS COURSE**  
We are excited to announce a new MSDS course! DSC 395T Data Science for Health
Discovery and Innovation will be taught Dr. Layla Parast and it will be first
offered in the Spring 2024 semester.  
  
**Course Title**  
Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation  
  
**Course Description**  
The purpose of this course is to introduce students to statistical methods
used for health data science. Equal emphasis will be given to the statistical
details of the methods and application to data. Each course component will
include an R demonstration as well as R activities to practice analytic
skills.  
  
The course will cover the following topics:  
(1) Survival analysis, including censoring and functions, nonparametric and
parametric estimation, competing risks, and prediction;  
(2) Longitudinal data analysis including linear and generalized mixed effect
models and generalized estimating equations;  
(3) Design and analysis of observational studies including propensity score
analysis and mediation analysis;  
(4) Design and analysis of randomized studies including sample size and power
calculations, intent-to-treat analysis, and noncompliance.  
  
At the end of this course, students will be able to determine the appropriate
method for a particular setting, apply the method, and interpret results,
incredibly value skills for a successful health data science career.  
  
**Course Prerequisites**  
This course is designed to be accessible to graduate students interested in
learning biostatistical methods and how to appropriately apply them to health
and medical data. Necessary background includes familiarity with probability,
regression, and mathematical statistics including likelihood estimation and
inference. Students should have experience and be comfortable working in R.  
  
**UPDATED MSDS PROGRAM OF WORK**  
With the addition of DSC 395T Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation
to the MSDS program, there has been an update to the MSDS program of work.
Attached to this email is an updated MSDS Program of Work checklist, and we
will detail the changes below.  
The MSDS program of work will now have four different categorizations of
courses: Foundational Courses, Additional Required Courses, Elective Course
Group 1, and Elective Course Group 2.  
  
Foundational Course: all three courses are required.

  * DSC 381 Probability
  * DSC 382 Regression
  * DSC 395T Data Structures & Algorithms  

Additional Required Courses: both courses are required.

  * DSC 391L Machine Learning
  * DSC 394D Deep Learning

Elective Courses - 1: students must complete three of the following four
courses.

  * DSC 383 Advanced Predictive Models
  * DSC 384 Design Principles & Causal Inference
  * DSC 385 Data Exploration & Visualization
  * DSC 395T Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation

Elective Courses - 2: students must complete two of the following three
courses.

  * DSC 388J Optimization
  * DSC 395T Reinforcement Learning
  * DSC 395T Natural Language Processing

  
Please note that the MSDS program will not allow substitutions of courses. The
elective courses will only count towards their specific group, and will not be
eligible to count as a Foundational Course, Additional Required Course, or
towards the other Elective Course Group.  
  
  
Best,  
Kathryn and Tim

error after trying to complete the application, please let us know. While the

deadline. Best, Kathryn and Tim **Please remember to include your EID on all

SEMESTERLY REMINDERS AND UPDATES MSDS students are encouraged to review the
MSDS Student Handbook every semester and you can always find the handbook in
the MSDS Central Course in edX. If at any time during the semester you have a
non-academic issue that interferes with your MSDS coursework such as an
illness, family emergency, change in job status, etc., then please reach out
to both your instructors and our office immediately. There is often little
recourse available if you reach out after the semester has ended. DSC 395T
Data Science for Health Discovery and Innovation will be taught in Canvas only
and it will not have an edX page. CONFIRMING ATTENDANCE FOR SPRING 2024 Every
student enrolled in the Spring 2024 semester needs to Confirm Attendance in
the My Tuition Bill webpage before January 19th. It is important to understand
that Confirming Attendance essentially confirms your commitment to attending
the Spring 2024 semester and paying for your course(s). If a student does not
Confirm Attendance, they may be automatically dropped from their courses by UT
system. If a student is dropped from their course(s) and wants to be added
back, they would incur a late registration fee (anywhere from $50 to $200 -
amounts are dictated by the Registrar). You may confirm attendance on the My
Tuition Bill page. Note that our department is part of the College of Natural
Sciences, so do not be alarmed if you see Natural Sciences listed there.
Please note that if you have recently registered for courses, it may take at
least 24 hours for your What I Owe page, edX and My Tuition Bill page (student
fees to be $0.00) to accurately reflect your registration. POINTS OF CONTACT
Throughout the semester you may need assistance. Here is a list to guide you:
Accounting Inquiries: CDSOadmin@austin.utexas.edu Program Inquiries:
MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu Class or content related issues: contact your
class TA (listed in syllabi) Technical issues with edX platform: support-
masters@edx.org SPRING 2024 DELETE DROP PERIOD We are currently in the Delete
Drop Period for the Spring 2024 semester, and it will run through January
31st. A student may drop a course online through the fourth class day (January
19th). From the fifth class day through the 12th class day (January 20th –
January 31st), a student will need to complete the Delete Drop Form that our
office will provide in the next few days. Please understand that if you add or
drop a course during this time period, our office needs 24 to 48 hours to
update edX and WIO. If you intend to drop your only course, or all your
courses, this is not a Delete Drop - this is a withdrawal. Only a certain
percentage of your tuition may be refunded. Information on how much will be
refunded is available through this link and on the back of the form you will
need to sign to withdraw. Here is how to request withdrawal information:
Email: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu Subject: MSDS – Spring 2024 - Withdrawal
Request – (YOUR EID) Body of email: include a request for withdrawing from the
semester. What to expect: A withdrawal form will be sent for you to complete.
SPRING 2024 GRADUATION APPLICATION During their final semester, all MSDS
students must apply to graduate. To learn more about graduation requirements
and to access the graduation application, please go here. If you receive an
error after trying to complete the application, please let us know. While the
University’s deadline to submit a graduation application is April 12th, 2024,
we ask that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please turn in
your application no later than 5:00pm on April 11th so we can complete and
submit the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate application should
only be submitted for those who plan on graduating at the end of this
semester. Students who do not complete this process by April 12th, 2024 will
not be eligible to receive their degree this spring. If you intend to graduate
this semester, go ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the
deadline. INTERNATIONAL STUDENT INSURCANCE WAIVER If you are an international
student, there is a chance you may automatically be enrolled in student health
insurance based on your status. You have probably been receiving emails from
the International Office and if you have not already done this, it is vitally
important for you to read this message from Texas Global to guide you: The
University of Texas Board of Regents requires all international students in a
F-1, F-2, J-1, or J-2 visa status to have health insurance coverage which
complies with the provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
(PPACA). For this reason, enrollment in the UT Student Health Insurance Plan
is automatic at the time of registration. This cost will be covered by the
department and then extended to the student in the middle of the semester.
International students who are studying within the US and do not want this
coverage, may request a waiver as long as they can show proof of health
insurance coverage that meets the Board of Regents requirements. This means
the student must submit the waiver form and submit proof of the required
health insurance coverage. It is the student’s responsibility to request a
waiver before the 10th class day of each semester. It is good to note that if
the proof of insurance does not include medical evacuation and repatriation
coverages, then the student will automatically be enrolled in this. The
department will extend this cost to the student. Please be certain to complete
this waiver form as soon as possible. The deadline is Monday, January 29th,
2024 at 5:00pm CT. SPRING 2024 IMPORTANT DATES Attached is a PDF of important
dates for our program. This is also available in your Central course. Best,
Tim, Ty, and Kathryn **Please remember to include your EID on all
correspondence and to not respond to these messages directly** \---

Hi, David, Thank you for applying to the Research Intern - Biomedical AI for
rare disease genomics (Job number:1668319) position at Microsoft! We're glad
you're interested in a career at Microsoft and we're here to help you find a
perfect fit. You may not receive feedback from us on your application
directly, but please know that it’s being evaluated, and you’ll hear from us
as soon as the review process is complete. If you’re selected for an
interview, you’ll be notified by someone on the recruiting team. You can view
your application status updates through your Action Center. If you see the job
moved to an Archived state, that means the position is either no longer open,
you withdrew from consideration, or you were not selected for the role. You
may notice that we move your application from one role to another. This may
happen a few times and is a normal part of our recruiting process. So, if you
see the job you applied to in an Archived state, and a new job listed as
Active, please know that this is normal and does not negatively impact your
candidacy in any way. How’s your profile? A key part of the review process is
evaluating your profile in relation to the job requirements, so please make
sure your profile is accurate and extensive – it’s our first step in getting
to know you! You can build your profile anyway you’d like – you can import it
from LinkedIn, manually update it, or import/attach a resume. The most
important thing is that your profile tells your story! We encourage you to
check back frequently and continue to look for opportunities that match your
interests, as new jobs are being posted regularly. Thank you, Microsoft
