| VOYA FINANCIAL  
Applicant Privacy Notice  
Last Updated: January 1, 2020  
  
Voya Financial, Inc. and its affiliated entities (together, "Voya") value your
trust and are committed to the responsible management, use and protection of
personal information. This Applicant Privacy Notice ("Notice") describes our
practices in connection with all the information that we collect through the
Careers section of our website (located at http://corporate.voya.com/careers)
("Careers Site"), through other online recruiting avenues such as LinkedIn and
Bloomberg, and offline in connection with your application for a job or
internship with Voya or one of our affiliates. Personal information submitted
elsewhere on Voya's and its affiliates' web sites will be used in accordance
with our general online Privacy Policy (https://www.voya.com/terms-
use#privacy).  
  
PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT  
  
Information You Provide  
  
We collect information from you in connection with the job application
process:  
  
Information we collect includes:  
  
\- Name, address, telephone number, e-mail address, and other contact
information;  
\- Username and password;  
\- Work authorization status;  
\- CV, resume, cover letter, previous work experience and education
information;  
\- Skills;  
\- Professional and other work-related licenses, permits and certifications
held;  
\- Information relating to references;  
\- Any other information you elect to provide to us (e.g., employment
preferences, willingness to relocate, current salary/salary expectation,
awards or professional memberships, personal websites or social media  
networks, verification of over-18 years of age, engagement in restrictive
covenants, and consents regarding the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Mutual
Arbitration Act); and  
\- Language.  
  
As discussed in the "Diversity" section below, in certain cases we will ask
questions about race/ethnic origin, gender, and disability of our applicants,
for monitoring equal opportunity. We can also inquire about criminal records.
We will do so only where permitted by applicable law. Otherwise, we ask that
you avoid submitting information which may qualify as sensitive information
under applicable law, except where such information is legally required.
Sensitive information includes race, religion, ethnicity, nationality or
national origin, age, gender identity, sex life or practices or sexual
orientation, marital status, medical or health information (including
disability status), genetic or biometric information, biometric templates,
political or philosophical beliefs, political party or trade union membership,
veteran status, background check information, judicial data such as criminal
records or information on other judicial or administrative proceedings.  
  
Any information you submit through the Careers Site must be true, complete and
not misleading. Submitting inaccurate, incomplete, or misleading information
may lead to a rejection of your application during the application process or
disciplinary action including immediate termination of employment. In
addition, it is your responsibility to ensure that information you submit does
not violate any third party's rights.  
  
If you provide us with personal information of a reference or any other
individual as part of your application, it is your responsibility to obtain
consent from that individual prior to providing the information to us.  
  
Information from Other Sources  
  
For the purpose of background check reports in connection with your
application, and as permitted by applicable law, Voya obtains information
about you from other sources.  
  
Other sources include but are not limited to:  
  
\- Your references;  
\- Prior employers;  
\- Educational institutions you attended;  
\- Verified passport;  
\- Verified driving license;  
\- Verified education certificates;  
\- Verified birth certificate;  
\- Verified utility bill;  
\- Employment reference;  
\- Employment reference;  
\- Criminal record report - basic level;  
\- Insolvency report;  
\- Credit report;  
\- Address check; and  
\- Drug test report.  
  
USE OF INFORMATION  
  
We collect and process information about you for one or more of these reasons:  
  
a) Because you voluntarily provide this information and consent for us to
process it;  
b) Because this information is necessary to take steps at your request prior
to entering into an employment or internship;  
c) Because this information is of particular importance to us and we have a
specific legitimate interest under law to process it;  
d) To comply with a legal obligation; or  
e) Where necessary to protect the vital interests of any person.  
  
The information that you submit on the Careers Site will be used for Voya's
global personnel recruitment, management and planning purposes, as permitted
by applicable law:  
  
\- To process your application. We will engage in these activities to manage
our prospective contractual relationship with you, based on our legitimate
interests;  
\- To assess your capabilities and qualifications for a job. We will engage in
these activities to manage our prospective contractual relationship with you,
based on our legitimate interests;  
\- To conduct reference checks. We will engage in these activities to comply
with a legal obligation or based on our legitimate interests;  
\- To respond to your inquiries and communicate with you about your
application, and to send you information regarding the Careers Site and
changes to our terms and policies. We will engage in these activities to
manage  
our prospective contractual relationship with you;  
\- To comply with or monitor compliance with any applicable law or regulation.
We will engage in these activities to comply with a legal obligation or based
on our legitimate interests;  
\- To conduct background checks if we offer you a position. We will engage in
these activities to comply with a legal obligation or based on our legitimate
interests; and  
\- To preserve our other legitimate interests, for example, for Voya's
administrative purposes, aggregate management reporting, internal training,
and as generally required to conduct our business within Voya and its  
affiliates.  
  
The information about you will be added to Voya's candidate database and can
be retained and used to consider you for opportunities at Voya and its
affiliates other than the one(s) for which you apply. If you do not wish us to
do this, please contact us at the address in the 'Contact Us' section below.  
  
If we hire you, personal information we collect in connection with your
application can be incorporated into our human resources system and used to
manage the new-hire process; any such information can become part of your
employee file and used for other employment-related purposes.  
  
Providing personal information to us through the Careers Site is voluntary.
However, if you do not provide sufficient information, Voya may be unable to
consider your employment application or, if you are hired, your subsequent
promotion, transfer or relocation.  
  
DISCLOSURE AND TRANSFER OF INFORMATION  
  
We will limit access to personal information to personnel with a business need
to know the information for the purposes described in this Policy, including
personnel in the recruiting, human resources and information technology
departments, and in the department responsible for the position for which you
are applying.  
  
Voya also shares personal information with our third-party service providers
to facilitate services they provide to us, including hosting and operating the
Careers Site, recruiting assistance, and background check processing.  
  
OTHER USES AND DISCLOSURES OF INFORMATION  
  
We also use and disclose your personal information as necessary or
appropriate, especially when we have a legal obligation or legitimate interest
to do so:  
  
\- To comply with applicable law.  
\- To respond to requests from public and government authorities.  
\- To cooperate with law enforcement.  
\- For example, when we receive law enforcement requests and orders.  
\- For other legal reasons.  
\- To enforce our terms and conditions; and  
\- To protect our rights, privacy, safety or property, and/or that of our
affiliates, you or others.  
\- In connection with a sale or business transaction.  
\- We have a legitimate interest in disclosing or transferring your personal
information to a third party in the event of any reorganization, merger, sale,
joint venture, assignment, transfer or other disposition of all or any portion
of our business, assets or stock (including in connection with any bankruptcy
or similar proceedings).  
  
DATA RETENTION  
  
We will retain personal information for the period necessary to fulfil the
purposes outlined in this Policy unless a longer retention period is required
or permitted by law. The criteria used to determine our retention periods are:
(i) the duration of the application process; (ii) as long as we have an
ongoing relationship with you; (iii) as required by a legal obligation to
which we are subject; (iv) as advisable in light of our legal position (such
as in regard of applicable statutes of limitations, litigation, or regulatory
investigations).  
  
We may remove personal information for inactive accounts from our database,
subject to any applicable legal or regulatory obligations. Furthermore, Voya
can delete personal information about you (including your CV/resume) from our
database at any time and without providing any reason. Therefore, please
retain your own copy of the personal information provided to us.  
  
PASSIVE INFORMATION COLLECTION: COOKIES AND SIMILAR TECHNOLOGY  
  
We and our service providers use "cookies" and similar technologies on the
Careers Site. Please see our Cookie & Similar Technologies Policy for more
information (https://www.voya.com/terms-use#privacy).  
  
CHOICES AND ACCESS  
  
If you register on the Careers Site, you may access, review, and change your
personal information stored therein by logging into the Careers Site and
updating your account information. The updated profile will be used as the
default the next time you apply for a job using your account online. To change
personal information that you have already submitted for consideration for a
specific position, please update your profile and resubmit your application
for that position. We encourage you to promptly update your personal
information if it changes or is inaccurate.  
  
You may, where permitted by applicable law, request to review, access,
correct, update, restrict suppress or delete your personal information;
request that we cease using your personal information as permitted by
applicable law; or request a copy or portability of your personal information.
Please make your request by visiting our website at
https://www.voya.com/content/personal-data-requests and following the
instructions under Personal Data Requests. To submit a request by telephone,
please call us at 855-663-8692. We will respond to your request consistent
with applicable law.  
  
SECURITY  
  
We seek to use reasonable organizational, technical and administrative
measures to protect personal information within our organization.
Unfortunately, no data transmission or storage system can be guaranteed to be
100% secure. If you have reason to believe that your interaction with us is no
longer secure, please immediately notify us in accordance with the "Contact
Us" section below.  
  
Voya hereby disclaims, as far as permitted by applicable laws, any liability
for itself and its affiliates and contractors for any personal information we
collect in connection with your application that is lost, misused, illegally
accessed, disclosed, altered or destroyed or not timely delivered to our
Careers Site.  
  
LINKS TO THIRD-PARTY WEBSITES  
  
This Policy does not address, and we are not responsible for, the privacy,
information or other practices of any third parties, including any third party
operating any website or service to which the Careers Site links. The
inclusion of a link on the Careers Site does not imply endorsement of the
linked site or service by Voya or our affiliates.  
  
DIVERSITY  
  
Voya is an equal opportunity employer, which means we offer equal treatment to
all applicants. Voya does not discriminate, either directly or indirectly, on
protected grounds. Such grounds are: race, colour, sex, gender identity,
sexual orientation, nationality, national origin, ethnic origin, religion,
beliefs or creed, age, disability, marital status, veteran status or genetic
information in any area of recruitment.  
  
LAW APPLICABLE TO JOB APPLICATION  
  
The Careers Site allows you to apply for jobs world-wide, as a benefit of
Voya's centralized global recruitment function. This Careers Site is operated
from the United States. Accordingly, any personal information you submit to
the Careers Site will be collected in the United States and will be subject to
U.S. laws. However, if we share your personal information with an affiliate
located in another country in its capacity as a potential employer, the
affiliate will handle your personal information in accordance with this
Policy. Any hiring or other employment-related decisions will be made by the
hiring affiliate in accordance with the laws of the country where the job will
be located.  
  
ABOUT CHILDREN  
  
The Careers Site is not intended for minors under the age of 18.  
  
CURRENT PERSONNEL OF VOYA  
  
If you currently work for Voya or one of our affiliates, you must be eligible
to apply for a different position within Voya to use the Careers Site. If you
accept such a position, your benefits programs and Human Resources policies
may change. Please consult with the HR manager for the new position concerning
application eligibility, benefit programs, and HR policies applicable to that
position.  
  
The Careers Site is not intended for distribution to, or use by, any person or
entity in any jurisdiction or country where such distribution or use would be
contrary to local law or regulation.  
  
CHANGES TO THE POLICY  
  
We reserve the right to amend this Policy at any time in order to address
future developments of Voya, the Careers Site or changes in industry or legal
trends. The "Last Updated" legend at the top of this Policy indicates when
this Policy was last revised. Any changes will become effective when we post
the revised Policy on the Careers Site.  
  
CONTACT US  
  
If you have questions, please contact us: at TalentAcquisition@voya.com or
Voya Talent Acquisition, One Orange Way, Windsor CT 06095  
Because email communications are not always secure, please do not include
sensitive information in your emails to us.

Hello,

We’re happy to inform you that you meet the minimum qualifications for our
2024 Summer Gridtern Program. We wanted to provide you with more information
about the next steps in our hiring process.  



Each candidate’s application is reviewed against our minimum qualifications
and the projects our managers have submitted for the role. Applicants who will
be considered further for the role will be invited via email in mid/late
January to participate in a digital interview through HireVue. Candidates who
are not invited for a HireVue interview will be notified by no later than
**February 7 th**.  



**_Timeline Overview:_**



**Date** |  **Update**  
---|---  
**Mid-January to Early February** |  Digital interviews are sent through HireVue   
**Mid-February** |  Final Round Interview Invitations Sent   
**Late February** |  Final Round Interviews Occur (Virtual)   
**Mid to Late March** |  Offers are made   
  


**_Applied to Multiple Summer Internship Job Postings?_**  



As we continue our application review process, should your application be a
good fit for other roles, you may receive this email more than once. You may
also be removed from the applicant pools where you do not meet minimum
qualifications such as major and skill set.  



If you have any further questions, you can email us at
EarlyCareersRecruitment@nationalgrid.com.



We look forward to reviewing your application further!  



Thank you,



Ivan Dyson & Brianna Fernandes

US Early Careers Recruitment Team | national**grid**

Hello, Thank you for your continued interest in the Gridtern Program at
National Grid. We have reviewed your application and would like to further
pursue your candidacy further. The next step in the process is to complete a
digital interview through HireVue. You will have until February 2nd to
complete your digital interview and you can complete it anywhere at the time
that suits you best! Shortly, you will receive an email from HireVue with a
link to your interview. This will come from interviews@hirevue.com with the
subject line “Interview with National Grid”. Please check your spam/junk mail
if you do not see this email by the end of the day today. The digital
interview should take you about 40 minutes to complete and will consist of 7
video interview questions followed by 3 game-based assessments. If you require
an accommodation, you will be able to note this via HireVue at the start of
your interview. Following the digital interview, the final step in our
selection process is participation in a virtual final round interview with the
hiring team for the role. Interviews will take place between February 21st and
February 28th. All candidates will be notified by late February about their
status. Should you no longer wish to be considered for a Gridtern position,
please respond to this email so that we can remove you from future
correspondence. Thank you, Brianna & Ivan US Early Careers Recruitment Team

\--- mail_boundary ---  Good morning,  
  
This email includes information on the following:  
  
  * QF Drop Period
  * Spring 2024 Graduation Application Reminder
  * Spring 2024 Receipts & Withdrawal Refunds 
  * Spring 2024 Important Dates

**QF DROP PERIOD**  
We are currently in the QF drop period which ends on the last class day, April
29th. This is applicable when a student is enrolled in more than one course
and intends to continue taking their other courses during the semester. Keep
in mind there are no refunds available with this option. It is important to
have contacted your instructor first to see if they are willing to sign the
drop form with a grade of a Q.  
  
**If you intend to drop one course and will still be enrolled in your other
course(s)** , you must send in a QF drop request. Here is how to send a
request:  
  
Email: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu  
Subject: MSDS – Spring 2024 – QF drop Request – YOUR EID  
Body of email: Include your name, EID, course & unique number  
What to expect: You will receive an email from DocuSign to complete the proper
form.  
  
QF drops are due on April 29th **at 12:00pm CT**. After April 29th, students
are no longer able to QF drop a course.  
  
**If you intend to drop your only course, or all of your courses** , _this is
not a QF drop— this is considered a**withdrawal**_. At this point in the
semester, no portion of your tuition may be refunded.  
  
Here is how to request withdrawal documentation:  
  
Email: MSDSgradcoordinator@utexas.edu  
Subject: MSDS – Spring 2024 – Withdrawal from Semester Request – YOUR EID  
Body of email: Include a request for withdrawing from the semester.  
What to expect: A withdrawal form will be sent for you to complete.  
  
The deadline to withdraw from the Spring 2024 semester is also April 29th at
12:00pm CT to account for processing.  
  
**SPRING 2024 GRADUATION APPLICATION REMINDER**  
During their final semester, all MSDS students must apply to graduate. To
learn more about graduation requirements and to access the graduation
application, please go here. If you receive an error after trying to complete
the application, please let us know.  
  
While the University’s deadline to submit a graduation application is April
12th, 2024, we ask that you do not wait until the last minute to apply. Please
turn in your application no later than 5:00pm on April 11th so we can complete
and submit the necessary paperwork on your behalf. A graduate application
should only be submitted for those who plan on graduating at the end of this
semester.  
  
Students who do not complete this process by April 12th will not be eligible
to receive their degree this spring. If you intend to graduate this semester,
go ahead and apply. No exceptions can be made if one misses the deadline.  
  
**SPRING 2024 RECEIPTS & WITHDRAWAL REFUNDS**  
Receipts were sent out on Friday for fully paid students as of the 6th of
February. Please be certain to check your spam folders in case it went there
on accident.  
  
Now that we are past the 20th class day, we will start processing withdrawal
refunds. We appreciate your patience while we process these.  
  
**SPRING 2024 IMPORTANT DATES**  
Attached is a PDF of important dates for our program. This is also available
in your Central course.  
  
Best,  
  
Ty, Tim & Kathryn  
  
_**Please remember to include your EID on all correspondence and to not
respond to these messages directly**_

Hi David Wang,  
  
Thank you for taking the time to apply to Intern the Otsuka Way: Data
Scientist- Otsuka Summer 2024 Internship. We appreciate your desire in joining
Otsuka. As you go through our hiring process, we take the time to review and
consider your professional background and experience and make sure that they
align with what’s needed for the role. Though your accomplishments are
remarkable, they didn’t exactly line up with what we’re looking for in this
certain job. We want you to know that there are a few key explanations as to
why it might not have worked out and some have nothing to do with you:  
  
1\. **Timing** : sometimes it just doesn’t work out for the role you want and
what we have available. It doesn’t mean that you aren’t qualified or capable
of handling the role.  
  
2\. **Shift in priorities** : we might have decided to go in a different
direction based on changing business needs.  
  
3\. **Internal Growth** : Growing our employees and ensuring they flourish in
their careers is a part of our Otsuka culture. We might have had some internal
movement for this position.  
  
4\. There might have been a more qualified candidate for the role.  
  
We understand that being rejected is always disappointing no matter how far
along you’ve made it in the process. But, don’t let it hold you back. Your
relationship with Otsuka doesn’t have to end here and there are some things
you can do to open yourself up to other possibilities:  
  
1\. Keep your resume up to date and make sure you document all your
accomplishments and success until you find another role to apply to here at
Otsuka.  
  
2\. Follow us on LinkedIn and stay in touch with Otsuka brand.  
  
https://www.linkedin.com/company/otsuka-pharmaceutical-companies/  
  
3\. Continue to search and apply for other job openings by visiting our
https://vhr-otsuka.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/External We’re constantly adding new
positions that may be a better fit for you.  
  
We wish you the best of luck as you continue your search and we hope that this
won’t be the last time we cross paths.  
  
Best,  
  
Otsuka Talent Acquisition Team

Dear David Wang,  
Congrats! You did it. You filled out all the required fields, uploaded your
resume and pressed that submit button.  Doesn’t it feel good?  
  
This is an automated email to let you know that we have received your job
application to Data Science Intern and are excited that you want to work for
Yum!, KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell or Habit Burger Grill. We think we’re an
awesome company to work for and know that we could be awesome-er (OK, that’s
not a real word, but let’s just roll with it) with a candidate like YOU.  
So, what now? Should you check your phone anxiously waiting for our call,
email or text? You could, but we don’t want that. We want you to go out into
the world as your best self, so rest assured, we won’t leave you hanging,
wondering what could’ve been.  
As the world’s largest restaurant company, we’re constantly reviewing
applications, interviewing folks and running over 48,000 KFCs, Pizza Huts and
Taco Bells. A real, live, human resources generalist (keyword there is
“human”) will review your application carefully and thoughtfully because you
carefully and thoughtfully took the time to fill it out!  
Until then, here are some links to check out, so you’ll understand more about
our company!   We could go on and on, but we’ll stop at five links. Pat
yourself on the back for submitting your application and know that we’ll be in
touch soon!

  * Our Culture
  * How We Work
  * Our Functions
  * Professional Development 
  * The Candidate Experience

We could go on and on, but we’ll stop at five links. Pat yourself on the back
for submitting your application and know that we’ll be in touch soon!  
Sincerely, The Yum!, KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and Habit Burger Grill
recruiting teams

All state agencies require that a State of Texas Application for Employment be
submitted for each position. Resumes are not accepted in place of
applications. Please be aware that it may take an extended period of time to
complete the application and it might be easier to complete on a computer vs a
phone.

Once you have completed the application, please email it to
apply@sao.texas.gov. If you have already completed your application, please
disregard this email.

If your qualifications match our needs, we will contact you about scheduling
an interview.  
  
Thanks again for your interest.  
  
\- Texas State Auditor's Office

Hi David, Thank you for taking the time to apply for the role of Strategic Student Program: Data Science and Analytics Intern (GSM; Summer 2024) (406438) at Siemens. On this occasion, we decided to move forward with other candidates. Due to the volume of applications that we receive, we are unable to provide individual feedback, but we thank you for considering Siemens and hope you will continue to explore our career opportunities. New opportunities arise every day to help us make real what matters, so please don't let this stop you from applying for a different role. We would like to also reassure you that, in case you have any other ongoing application processes, these will not be affected by this outcome. Hello David,We have reviewed your application for AI/ML Engineering Internship
and would like to invite you to schedule a phone interview with us.  
To streamline the process, please use the following link to access my calendar
and choose a time that works best for you:
https://outlook.office365.com/owa/calendar/RecruiterPhoneScreen@HoneywellProd.onmicrosoft.com/bookings/  
Please reach out if you are not able to find a time that fits your schedule.  
After you select a time, you will be sent a calendar confirmation with an MS
Teams link we will use for the audio call. If you do not see it in your inbox,
please check your spam filter.  
In our call, we will work together to fill out a profile for you and highlight
your relevant skills. Some areas we will touch on are:

  * understanding of statistics, probability, ML and DL
  * experience in developing and deploying end-to-end AI/ML solutions (this can be from coursework, projects, previous internships, etc.)
  * exposure to AI/ML and DL frameworks like Databricks, Langchain, OpenAI, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe, etc.


Most applicants will not have experience in all areas, so we will just focus
on filling in relevant examples.  
Looking forward to connecting and learning more about your skills and
experience.  
Best,

Dear David Wang,  
  
Congrats! You did it. You filled out all of the required fields, uploaded your
resume and pressed that submit button. Doesn’t it feel good?  
  
This is an automated email to let you know that we have received your job
application to Data Science Intern and are excited that you want to work for
Yum!, KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell or Habit Burger Grill. We think we’re an
awesome company to work for and know that we could be awesome-er (OK, that’s
not a real word, but let’s just roll with it) with a candidate like YOU.  
  
Like we said, this is an automated email sent by a computer (re: please don’t
reply because no one will respond, and that would make us both sad), but it’s
not your typical “we’ll be in touch” message, so please read on!  
  
So, what now? Should you check your phone anxiously waiting for our call,
email or text? You could, but your friends and family would miss your smiling
face and might blame our company for stealing that pep in your step. We don’t
want that. We want you to go out into the world as your best self, so rest
assured, you will hear from us, even if it’s another automated email saying
that you didn’t get the job, but you WILL hear from us. We don’t believe in
leaving you hanging, wondering what could’ve been.  
  
But WHEN will you hear from us? Well, that’s hard to answer. As the world’s
largest restaurant company, we’re constantly reviewing applications,
interviewing folks and running over 48,000 KFCs, Pizza Huts and Taco Bells.
Rest assured, a real, live, human resources generalist (keyword there is
“human”) will review your application carefully and thoughtfully because you
carefully and thoughtfully took the time to fill it out!  
  
Until then, here are some links to check out, so you’ll understand more about
our company and how awesome we are. Wait, does that make us look egotistical?
Who even says “egotistical?” See? Don’t worry about saying the wrong thing in
your application because we already have! We’re all human and celebrate our
differences here.

  * Our Culture
  * How We Work
  * Our Functions
  * Professional Development 
  * The Candidate Experience

We could go on and on, but we’ll stop at five links. We know you have a life
to live, and we have your application to review! So, pat yourself on the back
for submitting your application and know that we’ll be in touch for realsies.
For realsies?! Sorry, we’re just nervous because we like you in the Sally
Field sort of way.  Sincerely, The Yum!, KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and Habit
Burger Grill recruiting teams

Hi David,



I hope you are doing well. I want to express my sincere gratitude for taking
the time to speak with me a few weeks ago. I appreciate your patience,
interest, and the effort you put into the application and interview process.



Regrettably, we are closing recruitment for this position and no finalist will

Hello, Pinterest has partnered with Veris Insights* to gather feedback (
https://survey.verisinsights.com/Pinterest-Brand-2024 ) from students to learn
what students are looking for when evaluating potential employers. To say
thank you, you will receive a $5 electronic gift card of your choosing
(including Amazon, Mastercard and charitable donations) upon completion. Click
here ( https://survey.verisinsights.com/Pinterest-Brand-2024 ) to complete the
survey: https://survey.verisinsights.com/Pinterest-Brand-2024 Participation
will not affect your potential candidacy or employment with Pinterest. All
survey responses are confidential, with information reported back to us only
in aggregate. Thank you in advance for sharing your time and valuable
perspective with us! *Veris Insights (
https://verisinsights.kinsta.cloud/brand-hub/ ) is an independent research
firm that helps employers improve their candidate experience. All responses
provided to Veris Insights are confidential, and no information you provide
will ever be tied to your name or any other personally identifying
information. If you have any questions about this survey or rewards, please
reach out to Kat Tuangco at ktuangco@verisinsights.com (
ktuangco@verisinsights.com?subject=Pinterest%20Brand%20Survey ). Best,
University Recruiting Team \--- mail_boundary ---

Good afternoon, I hope this email finds you well. Thank you for applying to
the Corporate Technology, Artificial Intelligence Internship opportunity at
Subway World Headquarters in Shelton, CT! I have reviewed your application and
would love to schedule some time for us to connect to discuss the position
further. Before we schedule a time to connect further I wanted to share and
confirm a few more key requirements and details about the position for you to
consider: * This is a part-time, temporary opportunity - ideal start dates are
May 20th, June 3rd or June 17th at the very latest. We are offering a maximum
of 29 hours per week and the program will run until August 2nd, 2024! * This
will be a fully on-site position, located in Shelton, CT. You must have
reliable transportation. We are not offering relocation, transportation or
housing stipends, so it is important that you will be located nearby! * We are
REQUIRING a GPA of 3.0 or higher and will need you to submit your transcript
in order to be considered. * Because this opportunity is part time, we are not
offering benefits. * We are offering an hourly pay of $18-22/hour, depending
on experience. * Virtual interviews will begin ASAP followed by an On-Site
interview in Shelton, CT the week of April 22nd! Interested candidates MUST be
able to complete these two interviews as described above in order to be
considered. * Candidates with family members who are currently employed by
Subway are unfortunately not able to be considered due to our Nepotism policy.
* Only students who are 18 years of age and "rising college Seniors" at a 4
year accredited school pursuing a Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related
field will be considered. A minimum of 75 credits must have been completed. *
This program is open to Green Card holders or U.S. Citizens. If after reading
the above you are still interested and qualified, please respond to this email

higher. 2\. Your portfolio of projects and/or your website. 3\. AI courses
you've taken. 4\. Programming languages you are familiar with. 5\. Requested
hourly rate. 6\. Your expected ability to start and the days/hours you would
prefer. 7\. Are you a Green Card holder or U.S. Citizen? 8\. Are you a rising
senior at a 4 year accredited institute? 9\. Are you 18 years of age or older?
10\. Have you completed 75+ credits? 11\. What is your availability for a
virtual interview the week of April 1st and an on-site interview the week of
April 22nd? 12\. Do you have reliable transportation to and from Shelton, CT?
Benefits of Interning at Subway: * The Shelton location has multiple On-Site
Gyms, Covered Parking, Salon/Spa, Daycare, Basketball Court, Tennis Court and
several eateries to choose from at discounted rates. * An amazing company
culture that breeds collaboration. * Hands on professional experience and
career support with the opportunity to be exposed to a variety of disciplines
and tools. Here is the official job posting for you to review again:

Good afternoon,

  

I hope this email finds you well.

  

Thank you for applying to the Corporate Technology, Artificial Intelligence
Internship opportunity at Subway World Headquarters in Shelton, CT! I have
reviewed your application and would love to schedule some time for us to
connect to discuss the position further. Before we schedule a time to connect
further I wanted to share and confirm a few more _key requirements and
details_  about the position for you to consider:

  

  * This is a _part-time, temporary_  opportunity - ideal start dates are **May 20th, June 3 rd  or June 17th** at the very latest. We are offering a _maximum of 29 hours per week_  and the program will run **until August 2nd, 2024**!

  * This will be a **fully on-site position, located in Shelton, CT**. You must have reliable transportation. We are not offering relocation, transportation or housing stipends, so it is important that you will be located nearby!

  * We are **REQUIRING a GPA of 3.0 or higher**  and will need you to _submit your transcript_  in order to be considered. 

  * Because this opportunity is part time, we are not offering benefits. 

  * We are offering an **hourly pay of $18-22/hour** , depending on experience. 

  * **Virtual interviews**  will begin ASAP followed by an **On-Site interview in Shelton, CT**  _the week of April 22nd!_  Interested candidates MUST be able to complete these two interviews as described above in order to be considered. 

  * Candidates with family members who are currently employed by Subway are unfortunately not able to be considered due to our Nepotism policy. 

  * Only students who are **18 years of age**  and "**rising college Seniors** " at a 4 year accredited school pursuing a Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field will be considered. **A minimum of 75 credits must have been completed.  **

  * This program is open to Green Card holders or U.S. Citizens.

  

**If after reading the above you are still interested and qualified, please
respond to this email with the following:**

  1. A copy of your transcript, showing a GPA of 3.0 or higher.

  2. Your portfolio of projects and/or your website.

  3. AI courses you've taken. 

  4. Programming languages you are familiar with. 

  5. Requested hourly rate. 

  6. Your expected ability to start and the days/hours you would prefer. 

  7. Are you a Green Card holder or U.S. Citizen?

  8. Are you a rising senior at a 4 year accredited institute?

  9. Are you 18 years of age or older?

  10. Have you completed 75+ credits?

  11. What is your availability for a virtual interview the week of April 1st and an on-site interview the week of April 22nd?

  12. Do you have reliable transportation to and from Shelton, CT?

  

  

**Benefits of Interning at Subway:  **

  * The Shelton location has multiple On-Site Gyms, Covered Parking, Salon/Spa, Daycare, Basketball Court, Tennis Court and several eateries to choose from at discounted rates. 

  * An amazing company culture that breeds collaboration. 

  * Hands on professional experience and career support with the opportunity to be exposed to a variety of disciplines and tools. 

  

  

Here is the official job posting for you to review again:

Job Description:  
Your Title: Data Engineer / Data Scientist Intern  
Job Location: Minnetonka, MN Westminster, CO Knoxville, TN Portland, OR
Dayton, OH Remote  
Our Department: Office of Technology Innovation - Analytics Team  
  
About Trimble’s Internship Program  
As a Trimble intern, you will not only gain valuable hands-on experience, but
you will also be given challenging, meaningful tasks that will give you
insight to what it's like working full-time as a valued member of a team. Our
internships are designed to prepare you for your career journey, while growing
as a professional through lunch and learns, professional development courses,
team-building activities, and social networking events with other interns
whether you are in person or remote. Over the course of your internship, we
want you to feel like you belong, innovate, and grow personally and
professionally. Join Trimble’s community to have a global impact where we
value you, your experience, and your skills to propel your career forward.  
  
Job Summary:  
Our data engineer / data scientist internship offers a variety of hands-on
experience, depending on your area of interest and experience. You will
receive hands-on experience using your data engineering and data science
skills in a professional setting while learning how to operate in an agile,
team environment.  
  
Key Responsibilities:  
* Become intimately familiar with data requirements  
* Manage, clean, and transform data for analysis using various programming languages  
* Work with data engineers to ensure that data is properly managed and secured  
* Work with data scientists on complex, multi-dimensional projects, and learn valuable leadership skills  
* Learn how to effectively work under pressure and as part of a team  
* Develop and implement machine learning models to solve business problems  
* Communicate insights from data analysis to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner  
Recommended Skills & Experience  
* Candidates currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other related field  
* Experience in any of the following languages: Python, Java, R, Scala, SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark, Hive  
* Ability to think critically and work independently and collaborate with a team  
* A wide degree of creativity, openness, and latitude when approaching problems  
Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Candidates must already
possess authorization to work in the United States of America without the need
for employer sponsorship.  
-

Hi David, I wanted to give you the good news that we would like to have you
move forward in the interview process. Please let me know your availability
for this week and early next week for a 45min technical interview. You will be
asked to work through a couple of example problems in SQL using a mock dataset
and a few Python problems. The emphasis will be more on general proficiency
with Python and SQL rather than complex algorithmic or data structure
questions. For Python, it is helpful to be comfortable with common data
science packages, such as pandas and scikit-learn, but not strictly necessary;
you are encouraged to look up and use any documentation that you may find
helpful during the interview. The interviewer usually asks that candidates
share their screen during the coding exercises so he can see what
documentation you are using though. I hope this helps but let me know if you
have any other questions for now. I look forward to hearing from you soon with
your availability. Best, Amy Sanchez

Hi David,  
  
Thank you for taking the time to apply to Computational ImmunoDermatology
Intern and going through our hiring process. We really appreciate your
interest in joining Johnson & Johnson. As you go through the process, we take
the time to review your professional background and experience and make sure
that they align with what’s needed for the role. Though your achievements are
impressive, they didn’t exactly line up with what we’re looking for in this
particular job. We want you to know that there are three main reasons as to
why it might not have worked out and some have nothing to do with you:

  1. Timing: sometimes it just doesn’t work out for the role you want and what we have available. It doesn’t mean that you aren’t qualified or capable of handling the role.
  2. Shift in priorities: we might have decided to go in a different direction based on changing business needs.
  3. There might have been a more qualified candidate for the role.

We understand that being rejected is always disappointing no matter how far
along you’ve made it in the process. But, don’t let it hold you back. Your
relationship with Johnson & Johnson doesn’t end here and there are some things
you can do to open yourself up to other possibilities:

  1. Continue to search and apply for other job openings by visiting our Careers Website. We’re constantly adding new positions that may be a better fit for you.

If you did not opt in during the application process and you would like
Johnson & Johnson to keep your application data on file with the purpose of
identifying and sending you relevant information about future career
opportunities that match your skills and preferences, please go here and
provide your consent.  
We wish you the best of luck as you continue your search and we hope that this
won’t be the last time we cross paths.  
  
Best,  
| Johnson & Johnson Talent Acquisition Team

Portfolio Analytics Intern at AstraZeneca group. Our employees sit at the

**JOB DESCRIPTION**  
  
You have applied for **R-198131 Commercial Excellence, Portfolio Analytics
Intern**  
  
Job DescriptionThis is what you will do:  
Global Marketing & Commercial Strategy is a fully integrated commercial
strategy team, aligning global marketing, new product strategy, and commercial
excellence across all therapeutic and disease areas.The team’s purpose is to
partner with both global colleagues (R&D;, Operations, Finance, Corporate
Affairs, et al) and regional and local Commercial colleagues to ensure the
successful development and launch of innovative therapies that will deliver
value for all our stakeholders.  
The Commercial Excellence Graduate Intern will gain exposure to and experience
in the areas of Portfolio Analytics, Competitive Intelligence, Market Insights
& Analytics, and Launch Excellence. In this role and through key projects, the
Graduate Intern will advance the impact of the Commercial Excellence Team
within Global Marketing & Commercial Strategy and the broader organization.  
This individual will work ‘hands-on’ leading high-impact projects, while also
learning more about how a rare disease biotechnology company operates globally
in these key areas.  
The primary focus of this position is Portfolio Analytics, with additional
opportunities and exposure to other Commercial Excellence functions.  
The Portfolio Analytics function conducts robust portfolio forecasting and
reporting capabilities to define financial opportunities across
indications/therapeutic areas for the pipeline which aid in enterprise-wide
portfolio decision making. This function supports assessment of internal and
external opportunities, including rationale, technical and commercial
considerations, in partnership with key organization stakeholders. The key
focus of this function is to provide financial and analytical support and
oversight and produce long-term topline and patient forecasting to enable
data-driven decision making (integrated with market insights), demand and
infrastructure planning, and deeper comprehension of underlying commercial
opportunities. This includes the development of strategic business cases,
scenarios, and inputs into portfolio prioritization.  
  
You will be responsible for:  
Designing and executing analyses of data and information to generate insights
and support the development of innovative medicines  
Collaborating across the Commercial Excellence team, broader Global Marketing
& Commercial Strategy team, and with external colleagues to identify areas of
exploration, define project scope and assumptions, identify available data
sources, brainstorm analysis approach, and gather feedback  
Preparing presentations to communicate your process and findings to key
stakeholders  
Working with vendors to execute projects for on-track, on-budget delivery  
Specific projects may include analysis, process enhancement and visualization
for forecasting. Forecasts for disease indications and product assets spans
patient and sales volumes, market share, sales uptake, revenue, etc.  
  
You will need to have:  
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent; graduate student in life sciences/healthcare,
business, data sciences, etc. (e.g., MBA, MIS, PhD). Advanced undergraduate
students with relevant internship experience may also apply.  
Portfolio Analytics intern will require a focus on Analytics, with
capabilities in data analytics, data engineering and visualization.  
Academic and/or professional experience that demonstrates an aptitude for or
strong interest in both data sciences, health care and business  
Understanding of the drug development and commercialization process  
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint and Excel  
The duties of this role are generally conducted in an office environment. As
is typical of an office-based role, employees must be able, with or without an
accommodation to: use a computer; engage in communications via phone, video,
and electronic messaging; problem solve; engage in complex and non-linear
thought, analysis, and dialogue; collaborate with others; maintain general
availability during standard business hours  
We would prefer for you to have:  
Research/analytical or commercial experience in the healthcare industry that
may include Business Analytics, Competitive Intelligence, Forecasting
Analytics, Market Research, Marketing, Project Management, Business
Development, Corporate Strategy, Financial Analysis, Consulting and/or
academic focus in one or more of these areas  
The Portfolio Analytics intern may have the opportunities to experiment with
Advanced Analytics Data Sciences such as Machine Learning. Some background
with AI/ML modeling is a plus.

Hi David,

On behalf of the Intuitive team, we would like to thank you for your interest
in our company and the time you took to apply for the Data Scientist Intern
role. Your application and the associated documents will be reviewed by the
University Hiring Program Team and if there is a match, a member of the team
will contact you to discuss next steps.  

We understand that looking for an internship can be daunting and time
consuming. While we can't promise that you will hear back immediately, we can
promise that we will review applicants fairly and consider your qualifications
throughout the entire recruiting season.

We believe that setting appropriate expectations and being transparent is a
good start. To that end, here's what you can expect:

  1. Internship recruiting season at Intuitive spans through Fall, Winter and Spring. We ensure that all opportunities are posted on the career site, and every applicant is assessed against the unique relevant qualifications for each internship role.
  2. Every hiring team proceeds to interviews at different points in the recruiting season, so if you have not heard back, your application is still in consideration. While we review your application, we encourage you to visit the Careers Page and stay engaged with us by signing up for job alert and joining our Talent Community. 

Best Regards,

Intuitive Talent Acquisition Team
